analyzed: ekādaśamam tasya mahā praṇidhānam abhūta yadā aham anāgate     tadā bodhi prāptasya
translated: His eleventh great vow was: 'In the future, when I have attained enlightenment,

original: ca me ye sattvāḥ kṣudhāgninā prajvalitāḥ āhārapānaparyeṣṭyabhiyuktāḥ tannidānaṃ pāpaṃ kurvanti / sacet
analyzed: ca me ye sattvāḥ kṣudhā agninā prajvalitāḥ āhāra pāna paryeṣṭi abhiyuktāḥ tad nidānam pāpam kurvanti saced
translated: may any beings who are burning with the fire of hunger, who are preoccupied with seeking food and drink, and who commit evil deeds on that account,

original: te mam nāmadheyaṃ dhārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te mam nāmadheyam dhārayeyuḥ
translated: if they were to remember my name,

original: ahaṃ teṣāṃ varṇagandharasopetena āhāreṇa śarīraṃ saṃtarpayeyam //
analyzed: aham teṣām varṇa gandha rasa upetena āhāreṇa śarīram saṃtarpayeyam
translated: may I satisfy their bodies with food that has color, smell, and taste.'

original: dvādaśamaṃ tasya mahāpraṇidhānam abhūt yadāham anāgate tadā bodhiprāptasya ca me ye kecit sattvā vasanavirahitā daridrāḥ śītoṣṇadaṃśamaśakrairupadrutā
analyzed: dvādaśamam tasya mahā praṇidhānam abhūt yadā aham anāgate      tadā bodhi prāptasya ca me ye kecid sattvāḥ vasana virahitāḥ daridrāḥ śīta uṣṇa daṃśam aśakraiḥ upadrutā
translated: His twelfth great vow was: 'In the future, when I have attained enlightenment, may any beings who are without clothing, poor, afflicted by cold, heat, mosquitoes, and flies,

original: duḥkham anubhavanti / sacet
analyzed: duḥkham anubhavanti saced
translated: and experiencing suffering,

original: te mama nāmadheyeṃ dhārayeyuḥ /🔽ahaṃ teṣāṃ ca vastraparibhogam upasaṃhareyam /
analyzed: te mama nāmadheyem dhārayeyuḥ  aham teṣām ca vastra paribhogam upasaṃhareyam
translated: if they should remember my name,🔽I will provide them with the enjoyment of clothing.

original: nānāraṅgai raktāṃś ca kāmānupanāmayeyam / BhgSū / Vaidya
analyzed: nānā raṅgaiḥ raktān ca kāmān upanāmayeyam bhgsū vaidya
translated: And I will offer them various colored garments and desires,

original: vividhaiś ca ratnābharaṇagandhamālyavilepanavādyatūryatālāvacaraiḥ sarvasattvānāṃ sarvābhiprāyān paripūrayeyam //
analyzed: vividhaiḥ ca ratna ābharaṇa gandha mālya vilepana vādya tūrya tālāvacaraiḥ sarva sattvānām sarva abhiprāyān paripūrayeyam
translated: and with various jeweled ornaments, fragrances, garlands, ointments, musical instruments, drums, and cymbals, I will fulfill all the wishes of all beings.'

original: imāni dvādaśa mahāpraṇidhānāni mañjuśrīḥ bhagavān bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhas tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvaṃ bodhicārikāṃ caran kṛtavān
analyzed: imāni dvādaśa mahā praṇidhānāni mañjuśrīḥ bhagavān bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvam bodhi cārikām caran kṛtavān
translated: These are the twelve great vows that the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, Bhaisajyaguru-Vidyut-Prabha, made in the past while practicing the conduct of enlightenment, Manjushri.

original: tasya khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya
analyzed: tasya khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya
translated: Moreover, Manjushri, that Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, Bhaisajyaguru-Vidyut-Prabha,

original: yat praṇidhānaṃ yac ca buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ tan na śakyaṃ kalpena vā kalpāvaśeṣeṇa vā kṣapayitum /
analyzed: yat praṇidhānam yat ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham tat na śakyam kalpena vā kalpa avaśeṣeṇa vā kṣapayitum
translated: The aspirations and the array of qualities of that buddha field cannot be exhausted in a kalpa or even the remainder of a kalpa.

original: suviśuddhaṃ tad buddhakṣetraṃ vyapagataśilāśarkarakaṭhalyam apagatakāmadoṣam apagatāpāyaduḥkhaśabdam apagatamātṛgrāmam /
analyzed: su viśuddham tat buddhakṣetram vyapagata śilā śarkara kaṭhalyam apagata kāma doṣam apagata apāya duḥkha śabdam apagata mātṛgrāmam
translated: That buddha field is very pure, free from stones, pebbles, and gravel, free from the faults of desire, free from the sounds of suffering and danger, and free from women.

original: vaidūryamayī ca sā mahāpṛthivī kuḍyaprākāraprāsādatoraṇagavākṣajālaniryūhasaptaratnamayī /
analyzed: vaidūrya mayī ca sā mahā pṛthivī kuḍya prākāra prāsāda toraṇa gavākṣa jāla niryūha sapta ratna mayī
translated: The great earth there is made of beryl, with walls, ramparts, palaces, archways, windows, lattices, and pinnacles made of the seven precious substances.

original: yadṛśī sukhāvatī lokadhātus tādṛśī /
analyzed: yadṛśī sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ tādṛśī
translated: It is like the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: tatra vaidūryanirbhāsāyāṃ lokadhātau dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau teṣām aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ pramukhau /
analyzed: tatra vaidūryanirbhāsāyām lokadhātau dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau teṣām aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām pramukhau
translated: In that world system called Vaidūryanirbhāsā, there are two bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, who are the foremost of those innumerable, countless bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas.

original: ekakaḥ sūryavairocano nāma /
analyzed: ekakaḥ sūryavairocanaḥ nāma
translated: One is named Sūryavairocana.

original: dvitīyaś candravairocanaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ candravairocanaḥ
translated: The second is named Candravairocana.

original: yau tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya saddharmakośaṃ dhārayataḥ /
analyzed: yau tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya saddharma kośam dhārayataḥ
translated: They uphold the treasury of the true Dharma of that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha.

original: tasmāt tarhi mañjuśrīḥ śrāddhena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā tatra buddhakṣetropapattaye praṇidhānaṃ karaṇīyam //
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi mañjuśrīḥ śrāddhena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā tatra buddhakṣetra upapattaye praṇidhānam karaṇīyam
translated: Therefore, Mañjuśrī, a faithful son or daughter of good family should make a vow for rebirth in that Buddha-field.

original: punaraparaṃ bhagavān mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtam āmantrayate sma santi mañjuśrīḥ pṛthagjanāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavān mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma santi mañjuśrīḥ pṛthagjanāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One addressed Mañjuśrī, the Youth: Mañjuśrī, there are ordinary beings, sentient beings,

original: ye na jānanti kuśalākuśalaṃ karma /
analyzed: ye na jānanti kuśala akuśalam karma
translated: who do not know what is wholesome and unwholesome karma.

original: te lobhābhibhūtā ajānanto dānaṃ dānasya ca mahāvipākam /
analyzed: te lobha abhibhūtāḥ a jānantaḥ dānam dānasya ca mahā vipākam
translated: Overcome by greed, ignorant of generosity and the great ripening of generosity,

original: bālāgramūrkhāḥ śraddhendriyavikalā dhanasaṃcayakṣaṇābhiyuktāḥ /
analyzed: bāla agra mūrkhāḥ śraddhā indriya vikalāḥ dhana saṃcaya kṣaṇa abhiyuktāḥ
translated: foolish as the tip of a hair, lacking the faculty of faith, devoted to hoarding wealth,

original: na ca dānasaṃvibhāge teṣāṃ cittaṃ kramate /
analyzed: na ca dāna saṃvibhāge teṣām cittam kramate
translated: their minds do not turn to the practice of generosity.

original: dānakāle upasthite svaśarīramaṃsacchedane iva vā manaso duḥkhaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: dāna kāle upasthite sva śarīram aṃsa chedane iva vā manasaḥ duḥkham bhavati
translated: When the time for giving comes, their minds are pained, as if their own flesh were being cut off.

original: aneke ca sattvāḥ ye svayam eva na paribhuñjanti /🔽prāgeva mātāpitṛbhāryāduhitṝṇāṃ dāsyanti /🔽prāgeva dāsadāsīkarmakarāṇām /
analyzed: aneke ca sattvāḥ ye svayam eva na paribhuñjanti  prāk eva mātā pitṛ bhāryā duhitṝṇām dāsyanti  prāk eva dāsa dāsī karmakarāṇām
translated: And there are many sentient beings who do not enjoy themselves,🔽let alone give to their parents, wives, and children.🔽Let alone to their slaves, servants, and workers.

original: prāgevānyeṣāṃ yācakānām /
analyzed: prāk eva anyeṣām yācakānām
translated: Let alone to other beggars.

original: te tādṛśāḥ sattvā itaś cyutvā pretaloke upapatsyante tiryagyonau vā /
analyzed: te tādṛśāḥ sattvāḥ itas cyutvā preta loke upapatsyante tiryagyonau vā
translated: Those beings, having fallen from here, will be reborn in the world of hungry ghosts or in the animal realm.

original: yaiḥ pūrvaṃ manuṣyabhūtaiḥ śrutaṃ bhaviṣyati tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam /
analyzed: yaiḥ pūrvam manuṣya bhūtaiḥ śrutam bhaviṣyati tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam
translated: But those who, when they were human beings, heard the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: tatra teṣāṃ yamalokasthitānāṃ tiryagyonisthitānāṃ vā tasya tathāgatasya nāma susaṃ /🔽mukhībhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatra teṣām yama loka sthitānām tiryagyoni sthitānām vā tasya tathāgatasya nāma su saṃ  mukhībhaviṣyati
translated: there, in the world of Yama or in the animal realm, the name of that Tathāgata will be present in their minds.

original: saha smaraṇamātreṇa ataś cyutvā punar api manuṣyaloke upapatsyante /
analyzed: saha smaraṇa mātreṇa atas cyutvā punar api manuṣya loke upapatsyante
translated: As soon as they remember it, they will pass away from there and be reborn among humans.

original: jātismarāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: jātismarāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will remember their previous lives.

original: te te durgatibhayabhītā na bhūyaḥ kāmaguṇebhir arthikā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te te durgati bhaya bhītāḥ na bhūyas kāma guṇebhiḥ arthikāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Frightened by the fear of the lower realms, they will no longer desire the objects of desire.

original: dānābhiratāś ca bhaviṣyanti dānasya ca varṇavādinaḥ /🔽sarvam api parityāgenānupūrveṇa karacaraṇaśīrṣanayanaṃ ca māṃsaśoṇitaṃ ca
analyzed: dāna abhiratāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti dānasya ca varṇa vādinaḥ  sarvam api parityāgena anupūrveṇa kara caraṇa śīrṣa nayanam ca māṃsa śoṇitam ca
translated: They will delight in giving, and they will praise giving.

original: yācakānām anupradāsyanti /
analyzed: yācakānām anupradāsyanti
translated: They will gradually give away everything, even their hands, feet, head, eyes, flesh, and blood to those who ask for them,

original: prāgeva anyaṃ dhanaskandham //
analyzed: prāk eva anyam dhana skandham
translated: let alone other kinds of wealth.

original: punar aparaṃ mañjuśrīḥ santi sattvāḥ ye tathāgatānuddiśya śikṣāpadāni dhārayanti /
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ santi sattvāḥ ye tathāgatān uddiśya śikṣā padāni dhārayanti
translated: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī, there are beings who uphold the precepts in the presence of the Tathāgatas.

original: te śīlavipattim āpadyante /
analyzed: te śīla vipattim āpadyante
translated: They fall into moral failure.

original: dṛṣṭivipattim ācāravipattiṃ vā kadācid āpadyante /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi vipattim ācāra vipattim vā kadācid āpadyante
translated: Sometimes they fall into the failure of view or the failure of conduct.

original: śīlavipannā ye punaḥ śīlavanto bhavanti /
analyzed: śīla vipannāḥ ye punar śīlavantaḥ bhavanti
translated: Those who have fallen into morality become moral again.

original: śīlaṃ rakṣanti /
analyzed: śīlam rakṣanti
translated: They guard morality.

original: na punar bahuśrutaṃ paryeṣyanti /
analyzed: na punar bahu śrutam paryeṣyanti
translated: But they do not seek much learning.

original: na ca tathāgatabhāṣitānāṃ gambhīram artham ājānanti /
analyzed: na ca tathāgata bhāṣitānām gambhīram artham ājānanti
translated: And they do not understand the profound meaning of the teachings spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: ye ca punar buhuśrutāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca punar buhuśrutāḥ
translated: And those who are learned

original: te ādhimānikā bhaviṣyanti mānastabdhāḥ /
analyzed: te ādhimānikāḥ bhaviṣyanti māna stabdhāḥ
translated: will be arrogant and conceited.

original: pareṣām īrṣyāparāyaṇāḥ saddharmam avamanyante pratikṣipanti /
analyzed: pareṣām īrṣyā parāyaṇāḥ saddharmam avamanyante pratikṣipanti
translated: They are envious of others, despise the true Dharma, and reject it.

original: mārapakṣikās te tādṛḥā mohapuruṣāḥ svayaṃ kumārgapratipannāḥ /
analyzed: māra pakṣikāḥ te tādṛḍāḥ moha puruṣāḥ svayam ku mārga pratipannāḥ
translated: Those deluded people, who are on the side of Māra, themselves follow the wrong path.

original: anyāni cānekāni sattvakoṭiniyutaḥatasahasrāṇi mahāprapāte prapātayanti /
analyzed: anyāni ca anekāni sattva koṭi niyuta ḥata sahasrāṇi mahā prapāte prapātayanti
translated: And they cause many hundreds of thousands of millions of other beings to fall into the great abyss.

original: teṣām evaṃrūpāṇāṃ sattvānāṃ bhūyiṣṭhena narakavāsagatir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām evaṃrūpāṇām sattvānām bhūyiṣṭhena naraka vāsa gatiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For such beings, their dwelling in hell will be mostly like that.

original: tatra BhgSū / Vaidya
analyzed: tatra bhgsū vaidya
translated: There, Blessed One, a doctor

original: yais tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyaṃ ḥrutaṃ bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yaiḥ tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those who hear the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: teṣāṃ tatra narake sthitānāṃ buddhānubhāvena tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyaṃ sumukhībhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tatra narake sthitānām buddha anubhāvena tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam sumukhībhaviṣyati
translated: by the power of the Buddha, the name of that Tathāgata will be present to their minds, and they will immediately go to the buddhafield of that Tathāgata.

original: te tataḥ cyutvā punar api manuṣyaloke upapatsyante samyagdṛṣṭisaṃpannā vīryavantaḥ kalyāṇāḥayāḥ /
analyzed: te tatas cyutvā punar api manuṣya loke upapatsyante samyak dṛṣṭi saṃpannāḥ vīryavantaḥ kalyāṇa āḥayāḥ
translated: Having died and left that hell realm, they will be reborn among humans, endowed with right view, energetic, and virtuous.

original: te gṛhān utsṛjya tathāgataḥāsane pravrajitvā ānupūrveṇa bodhisattvacārikāṃ paripūrayiṣyanti //
analyzed: te gṛhān utsṛjya tathāgataḥ āsane pravrajitvā ānupūrveṇa bodhisattva cārikām paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: They will renounce their homes and go forth into the teachings of the Tathāgata. In due course, they will fulfill the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: punar aparaṃ mañjuśrīḥ santi sattvāḥ ye ātmano varṇaṃ bhāṣante matsariṇaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ santi sattvāḥ ye ātmanaḥ varṇam bhāṣante matsariṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, there are beings who praise themselves and speak ill of others out of jealousy.

original: pareṣām avarṇam uccārayanti /
analyzed: pareṣām avarṇam uccārayanti
translated: They speak ill of others.

original: ātmotkarṣakaparapaṃsakāḥ sattvāḥ parasparasatkṛtvāḥ tryapāyeṣu bahūni varṣasahasrāṇi duḥkham anubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ātma utkarṣaka parapaṃsakāḥ sattvāḥ paraspara satkṛtvāḥ tri apāyeṣu bahūni varṣa sahasrāṇi duḥkham anubhaviṣyanti
translated: Those beings who praise themselves and speak ill of others will experience suffering in the three lower realms for many thousands of years, honoring each other.

original: te anekavarṣasahasrāṇām atyayena tataś cyutvā gavāśvoṣṭragardabhādiṣu tiryagyoniṣu upapadyante /
analyzed: te aneka varṣa sahasrāṇām atyayena tatas cyutvā gavāśva uṣṭra gardabha ādiṣu tiryagyoniṣu upapadyante
translated: After many thousands of years have passed, they will fall from there and be reborn among animals such as cows, horses, camels, and donkeys.

original: kaśādaṇḍaprahāreṇa tāḍitāḥ kṣuttarṣapīḍitaśarīrā mahāntaṃ bhāraṃ vahamānā mārgaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: kaśā daṇḍa prahāreṇa tāḍitāḥ kṣudh tarṣa pīḍita śarīrāḥ mahāntam bhāram vahamānāḥ mārgam gacchanti
translated: They are beaten with whips and sticks, their bodies afflicted by hunger and thirst, carrying a great load, and go along the road.

original: yadi kadācit manuṣyajanmapratilābhaṃ pratilapsyante /
analyzed: yadi kadācid manuṣya janma pratilābham pratilapsyante
translated: If at some time they obtain birth as a human,

original: te nityakālaṃ nīcakuleṣu upapatsyante /
analyzed: te nityakālam nīca kuleṣu upapatsyante
translated: they will always be reborn in low families.

original: dāsatve ca paravaśagatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: dāsa tve ca para vaśa gatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will be slaves, under the control of others.

original: yaiḥ pūrvaṃ manuṣyabhūtais tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyaṃ śrutaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yaiḥ pūrvam manuṣya bhūtaiḥ tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam śrutam bhaviṣyati
translated: Those who in the past, as humans, have heard the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: te tena kuśalamūlena sarvaduḥkhebhyaḥ parimokṣyante /
analyzed: te tena kuśala mūlena sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ parimokṣyante
translated: by that root of merit they will be freed from all suffering.

original: tīkṣṇendriyāś ca bhaviṣyanti paṇḍitā vyaktā meghāvinaś ca /
analyzed: tīkṣṇa indriyāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti paṇḍitāḥ vyaktāḥ meghāvinaḥ ca
translated: They will have sharp faculties, be wise, clear, and of great understanding.

original: kuśalaparyeṣṭyabhiyuktā nityaṃ ca kalyāṇamitrasamavadhānaṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: kuśala paryeṣṭi abhiyuktāḥ nityam ca kalyāṇa mitra samavadhānam lapsyante
translated: They will be devoted to seeking what is wholesome and will always obtain association with spiritual friends.

original: mārapāśam ucchidya avidyāṇḍakośaṃ bhindanti /
analyzed: māra pāśam ucchidya avidyā aṇḍa kośam bhindanti
translated: They will cut the bonds of Māra and break the shell of the egg of ignorance.

original: kleśanadīm ucchoṣayanti /
analyzed: kleśa nadīm ucchoṣayanti
translated: They will dry up the river of afflictions.

original: jātijarāvyādhimaraṇabhayaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsebhyaḥ parimucyanti //
analyzed: jāti jarā vyādhi maraṇa bhaya śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsebhyaḥ parimucyanti
translated: They will be freed from the fears of birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.🔽Therefore, noble sons, you should honor, venerate, and make offerings to the spiritual friends who teach the Dharma in this way.

original: punar aparaṃ mañjuśrīḥ santi sattvāḥ ye paiśunyābhiratāḥ sattvānāṃ parasparaṃ kalahavigrahavivādān kārāpayanti /
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ santi sattvāḥ ye paiśunya abhiratāḥ sattvānām parasparam kalaha vigraha vivādān kārāpayanti
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, there are beings who delight in slander and cause beings to quarrel, dispute, and fight with each other.

translated: And, Blessed One, they will proclaim this jewel of a sūtra.

translated: They will remember the extensive and detailed past aspirations of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha, and the name of that Tathāgata.

analyzed: teṣām na akāla maraṇam bhaviṣyati

translated: That image of the Tathāgata should be circumambulated to the right while playing various musical instruments, and the fulfilled aspirations of that Tathāgata should be kept in mind.

translated: All evil dreams, inauspicious signs, and misfortune will be pacified.

original: BhgSū / Vaidya yeṣām agryudakaviṣaśasrapratāpacaṇḍahastisiṃhavyāghraṛkṣatarakṣudvīpikāśīviṣavṛścikaśatapadadaṃśamaśakādibhayaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: vaidya yeṣām agri udaka viṣa śasra pratāpa caṇḍa hasti siṃha vyāghra ṛkṣa tarakṣu dvīpi kāśīviṣa vṛścika śatapada daṃśa maśaka ādi bhayam bhavati
translated: Those who are afraid of the foremost of water, poison, weapons, heat, wild elephants, lions, tigers, bears, wolves, leopards, snakes, scorpions, centipedes, mosquitoes, flies, and so on,

original: tais tasya tathāgatasya pūjā kartavyā /
analyzed: taiḥ tasya tathāgatasya pūjā kartavyā
translated: for them, worship of that Tathagata should be performed.

original: te sarvabhayebhyaḥ parimokṣyante /
analyzed: te sarva bhayebhyaḥ parimokṣyante
translated: They will be liberated from all fears.

original: yeṣāṃ corabhayaṃ taskarabhayam /
analyzed: yeṣām cora bhayam taskara bhayam
translated: Those who are afraid of thieves, afraid of robbers,

original: tais tasya tathāgatasya pūjā kartavyā //
analyzed: taiḥ tasya tathāgatasya pūjā kartavyā
translated: for them, worship of that Tathagata should be performed.

original: punar aparaṃ mañjuśrīḥ ye śrāddhāḥ kulaputrā va kuladuhitaro vā ye yāvajjīvaṃ triśaraṇam upagṛhṇanti /
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ ye śrāddhāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā ye yāvajjīvam triśaraṇam upagṛhṇanti
translated: Moreover, Manjushri, those faithful sons and daughters of good family who, for as long as they live, take refuge in the Three,

original: ananyadevatāś ca bhavanti /
analyzed: an anya devatāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: and who do not have other deities,

original: ye pañca śikṣāpadāni dhārayanti /
analyzed: ye pañca śikṣā padāni dhārayanti
translated: who uphold the five precepts,

original: ye ca bodhisattvasaṃvaraṃ caturvaraśikṣāpadaśataṃ dhārayanti /
analyzed: ye ca bodhisattva saṃvaram catur vara śikṣā pada śatam dhārayanti
translated: and those who uphold the one hundred and four excellent precepts of the bodhisattva vow,

original: ye punar apiraṃ niṣkrāntagṛhavāsā bhikṣavaḥ /🔽pañcādhike dve śikṣāpadaśate dhārayanti /
analyzed: ye punar apiram niṣkrānta gṛha vāsāḥ bhikṣavaḥ  pañca adhike dve śikṣā pada śate dhārayanti
translated: and those bhikshus who have left the household life,🔽who uphold the two hundred and fifty precepts,

original: yā bhikṣuṇyaḥ pañcaśataśikṣāpadāni dhārayanti /
analyzed: yāḥ bhikṣuṇyaḥ pañcaśata śikṣā padāni dhārayanti
translated: and those bhikshunis who uphold the five hundred precepts,

original: ye ca yathāparigṛhītāc chikṣāsaṃvarād anyatarāc chikṣāpadāt bhraṣṭā bhavanti saced durgatibhayabhītāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca yathā parigṛhītāt śikṣā saṃvarāt anyatarāt śikṣā padāt bhraṣṭāḥ bhavanti saced durgati bhaya bhītāḥ
translated: And those who have fallen from any one precept of the training vow that they have taken, if they are afraid of the lower realms,

original: tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyaṃ dhārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam dhārayeyuḥ
translated: they should remember the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha.

original: na bhūyas teṣāṃ tryapāyagamanaduḥkhaṃ pratikāṅkṣitavyam /
analyzed: na bhūyaḥ teṣām tri apāya gamana duḥkham pratikāṅkṣitavyam
translated: They should not expect to go to the three lower realms again.

original: yaś ca mātṛgrāmaḥ prasavanakāle tīvrāṃ duḥkhāṃ kharāṃ kaṭukāṃ vedanāṃ vedayati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca mātṛgrāmaḥ prasavana kāle tīvrām duḥkhām kharām kaṭukām vedanām vedayati
translated: And if a woman in childbirth is experiencing severe pain,

original: yā tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam anusmaret /
analyzed: yā tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam anusmaret
translated: she should remember the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: pūjāṃ ca kuryāt /
analyzed: pūjām ca kuryāt
translated: and make an offering.

original: sā sukhaṃ ca prasūyate /🔽sarvāṅgaparipūrṇaṃ putraṃ ca
analyzed: sā sukham ca prasūyate  sarva aṅga paripūrṇam putram ca
translated: She will give birth easily,

original: janayiṣyati abhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyas tīkṣṇendriyo buddhimān /
analyzed: janayiṣyati abhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ tīkṣṇa indriyaḥ buddhimān
translated: and will give birth to a son who is complete in all his limbs and faculties, handsome, good-looking, and lovely, with sharp faculties, and intelligent.

original: sa ārogyasvalpābādho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saḥ ārogya su alpa ābādhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be healthy and have few troubles.

original: na ca śakyate amanuṣyais tasya ojo 'pahartum //
analyzed: na ca śakyate amanuṣyaiḥ tasya ojaḥ pahartum
translated: And it will not be possible for non-humans to steal his vital energy.

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma śraddadhāsi tvam ānanda🔽pattīyasi yad ahaṃ tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma  śraddadhāsi tvam ānanda  yat aham tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda, Ānanda, do you have faith

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya guṇān varṇayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya guṇān varṇayiṣyāmi
translated: and accept that I will praise the qualities of that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha?

original: athavā te kāṅkṣā vā vimatir vā vicikitsā vā atra gambhīre buddhagocare /
analyzed: athavā te kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā atra gambhīre buddha gocare
translated: Or do you have doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about this profound domain of the Buddhas?

original: athāyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat na me bhadanta bhagavan atra kāṅkṣā vā vimatir vā vicikitsā vā tathāgatabhāṣiteṣu sūtrānteṣu /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat na me bhadanta bhagavan atra kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā tathāgata bhāṣiteṣu sūtrānteṣu
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, I have no doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: nāsti tathāgatānām apariśuddhakāyavāṅbhanaḥsamudācāratā /
analyzed: na asti tathāgatānām a pariśuddha kāya vāc bha naḥ samudācāra tā
translated: The Tathāgatas have no impure conduct of body, speech, or mind.

original: imau bhagavan candrasūryau evaṃ maharddhikau evaṃ mahānubhāvau pṛthivyāṃ prapatetām /
analyzed: imau bhagavan candra sūryau evam maharddhikau evam mahā anubhāvau pṛthivyām prapatetām
translated: Blessed One, these moon and sun, which have such great power and such great majesty, might fall to the ground;

original: sa sumerur vā parvatarājaḥ sthānāc calet /
analyzed: sa sumeruḥ vā parvata rājaḥ sthānāt calet
translated: that Sumeru, the king of mountains, might move from its base;

original: na tu buddhānāṃ vacanam anyathā bhavet /
analyzed: na tu buddhānām vacanam anyathā bhavet
translated: but the words of the Buddhas could not be otherwise.

original: kiṃ tu bhadanta santi sattvāḥ śraddhendriyavikalāḥ /
analyzed: kim tu bhadanta santi sattvāḥ śraddhā indriya vikalāḥ
translated: But, Venerable Sir, there are beings who are deficient in the faculty of faith.

original: idaṃ buddhagocaraṃ śrutvāṃ evaṃ vakṣyanti katham etan nāmadheyasmaraṇamātreṇa tasya tathāgatasya tāvanto guṇānuśaṃsā bhavanti /
analyzed: idam buddha gocaram śrutvā evam vakṣyanti katham etat nāmadheya smaraṇa mātreṇa tasya tathāgatasya tāvantaḥ guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ bhavanti
translated: Having heard this sphere of activity of the Buddhas, they will say, 'How can there be so many benefits and virtues from merely recollecting the name of that Tathāgata?'

original: te na śraddadhanti na pattīyanti /
analyzed: te na śraddadhanti na pattīyanti
translated: They will not have faith in it, will not accept it.

original: pratikṣipanti/
analyzed: pratikṣipanti
translated: They will reject it.

original: teṣāṃ dīrgharātram anarthāya na hitāya na sukhāya vinipātāy bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām dīrgharātram anarthāya na hitāya na sukhāya vinipātāya bhaviṣyati
translated: That will be for their harm, unhappiness, and misery for a long time, and will lead to their downfall.

original: bhagavān āha asthānam ānanda anavakāśaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha asthānam ānanda anavakāśaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said: Ānanda, it is impossible, it cannot happen,

original: yena tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyaṃ śrutam /
analyzed: yena tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam śrutam
translated: that a being who has heard the name of that Tathāgata

original: tasya sattvasya durgatyapāyagamanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tasya sattvasya durgati apāya gamanam bhavet
translated: would go to the lower realms.

original: nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: duḥśraddhānīyaṃ ca ānanda buddhānāṃ buddhagocaram /
analyzed: duḥśraddhānīyam ca ānanda buddhānām buddha gocaram
translated: Ānanda, the sphere of activity of the Buddhas is difficult to believe.

original: yat tvam ānanda śraddadhāsi pattīyasi /
analyzed: yat tvam ānanda śraddadhāsi pattīyasi
translated: Ānanda, you have faith in it, you accept it.

original: tathāgatasyaiṣonubhāvo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgatasya eṣaḥ anubhāvaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: That should be seen as the power of the Tathāgata.

original: abhūmir atra sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ sthāpayitvā ekajātipratibaddhān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān iti /
analyzed: abhūmiḥ atra sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām sthāpayitvā eka jāti pratibaddhān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān iti
translated: This is not the level of all the Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas, except for the Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who are bound to one birth.

original: durlabhaḥ ānanda manuṣyapratilābhaḥ /
analyzed: durlabhaḥ ānanda manuṣya pratilābhaḥ
translated: Ananda, it is difficult to obtain a human birth.

original: durlabhaṃ triratne śraddhāgauravam /
analyzed: durlabham triratne śraddhā gauravam
translated: It is difficult to have faith and respect for the Three Jewels.

original: sudurlabhaṃ tathāgatasya nāmadheyaśravaṇam /
analyzed: su durlabham tathāgatasya nāmadheya śravaṇam
translated: It is extremely difficult to hear the name of the Tathagata.

original: tasya bhagavatas tathāgatasya bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya ānanda bodhisattvacaryām apramāṇam /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ tathāgatasya bhaiṣajya guru vaidūrya prabhasya ānanda bodhisattva caryām apramāṇam
translated: Ananda, the bodhisattva conduct of that Blessed One, the Tathagata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha, is immeasurable.

original: upāyakauśalyam apy apramāṇam /
analyzed: upāya kauśalyam api apramāṇam
translated: His skillful means are also immeasurable.

original: apramāṇaṃ cāsya praṇidhānaviśeṣavistaram /🔽ākāṅkṣamāṇo 'haṃ tasya tathāgatasya kalpaṃ vā BhgSū / Vaidya
analyzed: apramāṇam ca asya praṇidhāna viśeṣa vistaram  ākāṅkṣamāṇaḥ ham tasya tathāgatasya kalpam vā bhgsū vaidya
translated: His special vast aspirations are immeasurable.

original: kalpāvaśeṣaṃ vā bodhisattvacārikāyāṃ vistaravibhaṅgaṃ nirdiśeyam /
analyzed: kalpa avaśeṣam vā bodhisattva cārikāyām vistara vibhaṅgam nirdiśeyam
translated: If I wished, Ananda, I could explain in detail the bodhisattva conduct of that Tathagata for an eon or the remainder of an eon.

original: kṣīyeta ānanda alpam /
analyzed: kṣīyeta ānanda alpam
translated: Ananda, it would diminish only slightly.

original: na tv eva śakyaṃ tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūrvapraṇidhānaviśeṣavistarāntam adhigantum //
analyzed: na tu eva śakyam tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūrva praṇidhāna viśeṣa vistara antam adhigantum
translated: But it would not be possible to reach the end of the details of the special vast aspirations of that Blessed One, the Tathagata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena tasyām eva parṣadi trāṇamukto nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saṃnipatito 'bhūt saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena tasyām eva parṣadi trāṇamuktaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃnipatitaḥ bhūt saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then at that time, in that very assembly, there was a bodhisattva mahasattva named Trāṇamukta who had assembled and was seated.

original: utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya
analyzed: utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya
translated: He rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantam etad avocat bhaviṣyanti bhadanta
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat bhaviṣyanti bhadanta
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with joined palms, and said this to the Blessed One: Venerable sir,

original: bhagavan sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye nānāvyādhiparipīḍitā dīrghavyādhinā kṣīṇagātrāḥ
analyzed: bhagavan sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye nānā vyādhi paripīḍitāḥ dīrgha vyādhinā kṣīṇa gātrāḥ
translated: in the future time, in the future period, there will be beings afflicted by various diseases, exhausted in body by long illness,

original: kṣuttarṣābhyāṃ śuṣkakaṇṭhoṣṭhā maraṇābhimukhā rorudyamānebhir mitrajñātisālohitaiḥ parivāritā andhakārāṃ diśaṃ paśyanto yamapuruṣair ākarṣyamāṇāś
analyzed: kṣudh tarṣābhyām śuṣka kaṇṭha uṣṭhāḥ maraṇa abhimukhāḥ rorudyamānebhiḥ mitra jñāti sālohitaiḥ parivāritāḥ andhakārām diśam paśyantaḥ yama puruṣaiḥ ākarṣyamāṇāḥ
translated: with dry throats and lips from hunger and thirst, facing death, surrounded by weeping friends, relatives, and kinsmen, seeing dark directions, being dragged by Yama's men,

original: ca /
analyzed: ca
translated: and so on.

original: tasya kalevare mañcaśayite vijñānaṃ yamasya dharmarājasyāgratām upanīyate /
analyzed: tasya kalevare mañca śayite vijñānam yamasya dharmarājasya agra tām upanīyate
translated: When his body is lying on a bed, his consciousness is brought before Yama, the King of the Dharma.

original: yac ca tasya sattvasya sahajānubaddham eva yat kiṃcit tena puruṣeṇa kuśalam akuśalaṃ vā kṛtaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yat ca tasya sattvasya sahaja anubaddham eva yat kiṃcid tena puruṣeṇa kuśalam akuśalam vā kṛtam bhavati
translated: Whatever that being has done, whether good or bad, that is naturally connected with him,

original: tat sarvaṃ sulikhitaṃ kṛtvā yamasya dharmarājasya upanāmyate /
analyzed: tat sarvam su likhitam kṛtvā yamasya dharmarājasya upanāmyate
translated: all that is well written down and presented to Yama, the King of the Dharma.

original: tadā yamo 'pi dharmarājas taṃ pṛcchati /
analyzed: tadā yamaḥ pi dharmarājaḥ tam pṛcchati
translated: Then Yama, the King of the Dharma, asks him:

original: gaṇayati yathākṛtaṃ cāsya kuśalam akuśalaṃ vā tathājñāmājñāpayati /
analyzed: gaṇayati yathākṛtam ca asya kuśalam akuśalam vā tathā ājñām ājñāpayati
translated: He orders according to his knowledge whatever good or bad deeds have been done by him.

original: tatra ye te mitrajñātisālohitāstasyāturasyārthāya taṃ bhagavantaṃ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhaṃ tathāgataṃ śaraṇaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye te mitra jñāti sālohitāḥ tasya āturasya arthāya tam bhagavantam bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabham tathāgatam śaraṇam gaccheyuḥ
translated: There, those friends, relatives, and kinsmen, for the sake of that sick person, should go for refuge to that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha.

original: tasya ca tathāgatasya pūjāṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca tathāgatasya pūjām kuryuḥ
translated: And they should make offerings to that Tathāgata.

original: sthānam etad vidyate yat tasya tad vijñānaṃ punar api pratinivarteta /
analyzed: sthānam etat vidyate yat tasya tat vijñānam punar api pratinivarteta
translated: It is possible that his consciousness will return again.

original: svapnāntaragata ivātmānaṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: svapna antara gataḥ iva ātmānam saṃjānīte
translated: He will perceive himself as if in a dream.

original: yadi vā saptame divase yadi vā ekaviṃśatime
analyzed: yadi vā saptame divase yadi vā ekaviṃśatime
translated: Either on the seventh day, or on the twenty-first day,

original: divase yadi vā pañcatriṃśatime divase yadi vā ekonapañcāśatime divase tasya vijñānaṃ punar api nivarteta /
analyzed: divase yadi vā pañcatriṃśatime divase yadi vā ekonapañcāśatime divase tasya vijñānam punar api nivarteta
translated: or on the twenty-fifth day, or on the forty-ninth day, his consciousness will return again.

original: smṛtim upalabheta /
analyzed: smṛtim upalabheta
translated: He will regain his memory.

original: tasya kuśalam akuśalaṃ vā karmavipākaṃ svayam eva pratyakṣaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tasya kuśalam akuśalam vā karma vipākam svayam eva pratyakṣam bhavati
translated: He will himself directly perceive the ripening of his good and bad actions.

original: jñātvā sa jīvitahetau na kadāpi pāpam akuśalaṃ karma kariṣyati /
analyzed: jñātvā sa jīvita hetau na kadāpi pāpam akuśalam karma kariṣyati
translated: Knowing this, he will never again, for the sake of his life, commit evil, unwholesome actions.

original: tasmāc chrāddhena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitā vā tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūjā kartavyā //
analyzed: tasmāt śrāddhena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitā vā tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūjā kartavyā
translated: Therefore, a faithful son or daughter of good family should make offerings to that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha.

original: athāyuṣmān ānandas trāṇamuktaṃ nāma bodhisattvam etad avocat kathaṃ kulaputra tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya pūjā kartavyā /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ trāṇamuktam nāma bodhisattvam etat avocat katham kula putra tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajya guru vaidūrya prabhasya pūjā kartavyā
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said to the Bodhisattva named Trāṇamukta, Son of good family, how should the Blessed One Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha be worshipped?

original: trāṇamukto bodhisattva āha ye bhadanta ānanda mahato vyādhitaḥ parimocitukāmāḥ /
analyzed: trāṇa muktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha ye bhadanta ānanda mahataḥ vyādhitaḥ parimocitu kāmāḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva Trāṇamukta said, Venerable Ānanda, those who wish to be freed from great illness,

original: tais tasyāturasyārthāya sapta divasāni āryāṣṭāṅgasamanvāgatam upavāsam upavasitavyam /
analyzed: taiḥ tasya āturasya arthāya sapta divasāni ārya aṣṭāṅga samanvāgatam upavāsam upavasitavyam
translated: for the sake of that sick person, should observe the noble eight-part fast for seven days.

original: bhikṣusaṃghasya ca āhārapānaiḥ sarvopakaraṇair yathāśakti pūjopasthānaṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: bhikṣu saṃghasya ca āhāra pānaiḥ sarva upakaraṇaiḥ yathāśakti pūjā upasthānam kartavyam
translated: And they should make offerings and attend to the community of monks with food, drink, and all necessary things, to the best of their ability.

original: bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya nāmadheyaṃ triṣkṛtvā rātryāṃ triṣkṛtvā divase manasi kartavyam /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajya guru vaidūryaprabhasya nāmadheyam triṣkṛtvā rātryām triṣkṛtvā divase manasi kartavyam
translated: They should keep in mind the name of the Blessed One Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha three times at night and three times during the day.

original: navacatvāriṃśadvāre idaṃ sūtram uccārayitavyam /
analyzed: navacatvāriṃśat vāre idam sūtram uccārayitavyam
translated: This sūtra should be recited in forty-nine doors.

original: ekonapañcāśad dīpāḥ prajvālayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: ekonapañcāśat dīpāḥ prajvālayitavyāḥ
translated: Forty-nine lamps should be lit.

original: sapta pratimāḥ kartavyā /
analyzed: sapta pratimāḥ kartavyā
translated: Seven images should be made.

original: ekaikayā pratimayā sapta sapta dīpāḥ prajvālayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: ekaikayā pratimayā sapta sapta dīpāḥ prajvālayitavyāḥ
translated: For each image, seven lamps should be lit.

original: ekaiko dīpaḥ śakaṭacakrapramāṇaḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ dīpaḥ śakaṭa cakra pramāṇaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Each lamp should be the size of a cartwheel.

original: yadi ekonacatvāriṃśatime divase āloko na kṣīyate /
analyzed: yadi ekonacatvāriṃśatime divase ālokaḥ na kṣīyate
translated: If the light does not diminish on the thirty-ninth day,

original: veditavyaṃ sarvasaṃpaditi /
analyzed: veditavyam sarva saṃpad iti
translated: it should be known as the attainment of all prosperity.

original: pañcaraṅgikāḥ patākāḥ ekonapañcāśadadhikāḥ kartavyāḥ //
analyzed: pañca raṅgikāḥ patākāḥ ekonapañcāśat adhikāḥ kartavyāḥ
translated: Multicolored banners should be made, exceeding forty-nine in number.

original: punar aparaṃ bhadanta ānanda yeṣāṃ rājñāṃ kṣatriyāṇāṃ mūrdhābhiṣiktānām upadravā vā upasargā vā pratyupasthitā bhaveyuḥ /🔽vyādhipīḍā vā svacakrapīḍā vā paracakrapīḍā vā nakṣatrapīḍā BhgSū / Vaidya
analyzed: punar aparam bhadanta ānanda yeṣām rājñām kṣatriyāṇām mūrdhābhiṣiktānām upadravāḥ vā upasargāḥ vā pratyupasthitāḥ bhaveyuḥ  vyādhi pīḍā vā sva cakra pīḍā vā para cakra pīḍā vā nakṣatra pīḍā vaidya
translated: Moreover, Venerable Ānanda, for those kings, anointed kṣatriyas, who may have calamities or misfortunes,

original: vā candragrahasūryagrahapīḍā vā akālavātavṛṣṭipīḍā vā avagrahapīḍā vā samutthitā /
analyzed: vā candra graha sūrya graha pīḍā vā akāla vāta vṛṣṭi pīḍā vā avagraha pīḍā vā samutthitā
translated: whether it be the affliction of disease, the affliction of their own army, the affliction of a foreign army, the affliction of the stars, the affliction of the planets, the affliction of the moon, the affliction of the sun, the affliction of untimely wind and rain, or the affliction of eclipses,

original: amāṅgalyā vā saṃkrāmakavyādhir vā vipad vā samupasthitā /
analyzed: amāṅgalyā vā saṃkrāmaka vyādhiḥ vā vipad vā samupasthitā
translated: or if inauspicious contagious diseases or calamities should arise,🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: tena rājñā kṣatriyeṇa mūrdhābhiṣiktena sarvasattveṣu maitracittena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tena rājñā kṣatriyeṇa mūrdhābhiṣiktena sarva sattveṣu maitra cittena bhavitavyam
translated: That king, a kṣatriya anointed on his head, should have a mind of loving-kindness towards all beings.

original: bandhanagatāś ca sattvā mocayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: bandhana gatāḥ ca sattvāḥ mocayitavyāḥ
translated: And the beings who are in bondage should be released.

original: tasya ca bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya yathāpūrvoktapūjā karaṇīyā /🔽tadā tasya rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya etena kuśalamūlena ca tasya bhagavato
analyzed: tasya ca bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya yathāpūrva ukta pūjā karaṇīyā  tadā tasya rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya etena kuśala mūlena ca tasya bhagavataḥ
translated: And the worship as previously described should be done for that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha.

original: bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūrvapraṇidhānaviśeṣavistareṇa tatra
analyzed: bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūrva praṇidhāna viśeṣa vistareṇa tatra
translated: Then, by that root of merit of that king, a kṣatriya anointed on his head, and by the extensive special previous aspirations of that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: viṣaye kṣemaṃ bhaviṣyati subhikṣam /
analyzed: viṣaye kṣemam bhaviṣyati subhikṣam
translated: there will be peace and prosperity in his realm.

original: kālena vātavṛṣṭiśasyasaṃpado bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: kālena vāta vṛṣṭi śasya saṃpadaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: In due course, there will be an abundance of wind, rain, and crops.

original: sarve ca viṣayanivāsinaḥ sattvā ārogāḥ sukhitāḥ pramodyabahulāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca viṣaya nivāsinaḥ sattvāḥ ārogāḥ sukhitāḥ pramodya bahulāḥ
translated: And all the beings dwelling in the realm will be healthy, happy, and full of joy.

original: na ca tatra viṣaye duṣṭayakṣarākṣasabhūtapiśācāḥ sattvānāṃ viheṭhayanti /
analyzed: na ca tatra viṣaye duṣṭa yakṣa rākṣasa bhūta piśācāḥ sattvānām viheṭhayanti
translated: And the evil yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, and piśācas will not harm the beings in that realm.

original: sarvadurnimittāni ca na paśyanti /
analyzed: sarva durnimittāni ca na paśyanti
translated: And they will not see any inauspicious signs.

original: tasya ca rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya āyurvarṇabalārogyaiśvaryābhivṛddhir bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: tasya ca rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya āyuḥ varṇa bala ārogya aiśvarya abhivṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And for that anointed kṣatriya king, his lifespan, complexion, strength, health, and prosperity will increase.

original: athāyuṣmān ānandas trāṇamuktaṃ bodhisattvam evam avocat kathaṃ kulaputra parikṣīṇāyuḥ punar evābhivivardhate /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ trāṇamuktam bodhisattvam evam avocat katham kula putra parikṣīṇa āyuḥ punar eva abhivivardhate
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said to the Bodhisattva Trāṇamukta, Son of good family, how does one whose lifespan is exhausted increase it again?

original: trāṇamukto bodhisattva āha nanu tvayā bhadanta ānanda tathāgatasyāntikāc chrutam santi akālamaraṇāni /
analyzed: trāṇa muktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha nanu tvayā bhadanta ānanda tathāgatasya antikāt śrutam santi akāla maraṇāni
translated: The Bodhisattva Trāṇamukta said, Have you not heard from the Tathāgata that there are untimely deaths?

original: teṣāṃ pratikṣepeṇa mantrauṣadhiprayogā upadiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām pratikṣepeṇa mantra oṣadhi prayogāḥ upadiṣṭāḥ
translated: For those, the use of mantras and medicines has been taught.

original: santi sattvā vyādhitāḥ /
analyzed: santi sattvāḥ vyādhitāḥ
translated: There are beings who are sick.

original: na ca guruko vyādhiḥ bhaiṣajyopasthāpakavirahitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca gurukaḥ vyādhiḥ bhaiṣajya upasthāpaka virahitaḥ
translated: But the illness is not serious, and they are without a physician or nurse.

original: yadi vā vaidyābhaiṣajyaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: yadi vā vaidyā bhaiṣajyam kurvanti
translated: If they do not take medicine,

original: idaṃ prathamam akālamaraṇam /
analyzed: idam prathamam akāla maraṇam
translated: this is the first untimely death.

original: dvitīyam akālamaraṇaṃ yasya rājadaṇḍena kālakriyā /
analyzed: dvitīyam akāla maraṇam yasya rāja daṇḍena kālakriyā
translated: The second untimely death is when someone dies by the king's punishment.

original: tṛtīyam akālamaraṇaṃ ye 'tīva pramattāḥ pramādavihāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīyam akāla maraṇam ye tīva pramattāḥ pramāda vihāriṇaḥ
translated: The third untimely death is those who are extremely heedless, who live in heedlessness.

original: teṣāṃ manuṣyā ojo 'paharanti /
analyzed: teṣām manuṣyāḥ ojaḥ paharanti
translated: For them, humans take away their vital essence.

original: caturtham akālamaraṇaṃ ye agnidāhena kālaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: caturtham akāla maraṇam ye agni dāhena kālam kurvanti
translated: The fourth untimely death is those who die in a fire.

original: pañcamaṃ cākālamaraṇaṃ ye ca udakena mriyante /🔽ṣaṣṭhakālamaraṇaṃ ye siṃha
analyzed: pañcamam ca akāla maraṇam ye ca udakena mriyante  ṣaṣṭhakāla maraṇam ye siṃha
translated: The fifth untimely death is those who die by water.

original: vyāghravyālacaṇḍamṛgamadhyagatā vāsaṃ kalpayanti mriyante ca /
analyzed: vyāghra vyāla caṇḍa mṛga madhya gatāḥ vāsam kalpayanti mriyante ca
translated: The sixth untimely death is those who go to live in the midst of lions, tigers, hyenas, and fierce animals, and die there.

original: saptamama kālamaraṇaṃ ye giritaṭāt prapatanti /
analyzed: kāla maraṇam ye giri taṭāt prapatanti
translated: The seventh untimely death is those who fall from a mountain cliff.

original: aṣṭamam akālamaraṇaṃ ye viṣakākhordavetālānuprayogeṇa mriyante /
analyzed: aṣṭamam akāla maraṇam ye mriyante
translated: The eighth untimely death is those who die by the application of poison, spells, or vetālas.

original: navamam akālamaraṇaṃ ye kṣuttṛṣopahatā āhārapānam alabhamānā ārtāḥ kālaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: navamam akāla maraṇam ye kṣudh tṛṣā upahatāḥ āhāra pānam a labhamānāḥ ārtāḥ kālam kurvanti
translated: The ninth untimely death is those who, afflicted by hunger and thirst, die in distress from not obtaining food and drink.

original: etāni saṃkṣepato 'kālamaraṇāni tathāgateṇa nirdiṣṭāni /
analyzed: etāni saṃkṣepataḥ kāla maraṇāni tathāgateṇa nirdiṣṭāni
translated: These are, in brief, the untimely deaths indicated by the Tathāgata.

original: anyāni ca aprameyāṇy akālamaraṇāni //
analyzed: anyāni ca aprameyāṇi akāla maraṇāni
translated: And there are other immeasurable untimely deaths.

original: atha khalu tatra parṣadi dvādaśa mahāyakṣasenāpatayaḥ saṃnipatitā abhūvan yaduta kiṃbhīro nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tatra parṣadi dvādaśa mahā yakṣa senāpatayaḥ saṃnipatitāḥ abhūvan yat uta kiṃbhīraḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Then, in that assembly, the twelve great yakṣa generals gathered together, namely: Kiṃbhīra, the great yakṣa general,

original: vajraś ca nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: vajraḥ ca nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Vajra, the great yakṣa general,

original: mekhilo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /🔽antilo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: mekhilaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ  antilaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Mekhila, the great yakṣa general,🔽Antila, the great yakṣa general,

original: anilo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: anilaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Anila, the great yakṣa general,

original: saṇṭhilo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: saṇṭhilaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Saṇṭhila, the great general of the yakṣas.

original: indalo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /🔽pāyilo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: indalaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ  pāyilaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Indala, the great general of the yakṣas.🔽Pāyila, the great general of the yakṣas.

original: mahālo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /🔽cidālo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: mahālaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ  cidālaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Mahāla, the great general of the yakṣas.🔽Cidalā, the great general of the yakṣas.

original: caundhulo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: caundhulaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Cauṇḍhala, the great general of the yakṣas.

original: vikalo nāma mahāyakṣasenāpatiḥ /
analyzed: vikalaḥ nāma mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ
translated: Vikala, the great general of the yakṣas.

original: ete dvādaśa mahāyakṣasenāpatayaḥ ekaikānucaraparivāritā ekakaṇṭhena bhagavantam evam
analyzed: ete dvādaśa mahā yakṣa senāpatayaḥ ekaika anucara parivāritāḥ eka kaṇṭhena bhagavantam evam
translated: These twelve great generals of the yakṣas, each with their retinue of followers, with one voice said this to the Blessed One:

original: āhuḥ śrutam asmābhiś ca bhagavatā buddhānubhāvena tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya
analyzed: āhuḥ śrutam asmābhiḥ ca bhagavatā buddha anubhāvena tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajya guru vaidūrya prabhasya
translated: By the Buddha's power, we have heard the name of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: tathāgatasya nāmadheyam /
analyzed: tathāgatasya nāmadheyam
translated: the Thus-Come One.

original: na bhūyo 'smākaṃ durgatibhayam /
analyzed: na bhūyas smākam durgati bhayam
translated: We will no longer have fear of the lower realms.

original: te vayaṃ sahitāḥ samagrā yāvajjīvaṃ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam sahitāḥ samagrāḥ yāvajjīvam buddham śaraṇam gacchāmaḥ
translated: We, united and harmonious, for as long as we live, go for refuge to the Buddha,

original: dharmaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: dharmam śaraṇam gacchāmaḥ
translated: go for refuge to the Dharma,

original: saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: saṃgham śaraṇam gacchāmaḥ
translated: go for refuge to the Saṅgha.

original: sarvasattvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya autsukyaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya autsukyam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: For the sake of all beings, we will strive for their benefit, welfare, and happiness.

original: yo viśeṣeṇa grāme vā BhgSū / Vaidya
analyzed: yaḥ viśeṣeṇa grāme vā vaidya
translated: Whoever, in a village or wilderness,

original: nagare vā janapade vā araṇyāyatene vā edaṃ sūtraṃ pracārayiṣyati /
analyzed: nagare vā janapade vā vā ā idam sūtram pracārayiṣyati
translated: in a city, a town, a forest, or a wilderness, will spread this sūtra.

original: yo vā tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya nāmadheyaṃ dhārayiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ vā tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajya guru vaidūrya prabhasya nāmadheyam dhārayiṣyati
translated: And whoever will uphold the name of that Blessed One, Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha,

original: pūjopasthānaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: pūjā upasthānam kariṣyati
translated: and will make offerings and serve him,

original: tāvat taṃ sattvaṃ rakṣiṣyāmaḥ /🔽paripālayiṣyamaḥ /🔽sarvāmāṅgalyāc ca parimocayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat tam sattvam rakṣiṣyāmaḥ  paripālayiṣyamaḥ  sarva amāṅgalyāt ca parimocayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: we will protect that being,🔽we will keep him safe,🔽and we will free him from all misfortune.

original: sarva eṣām āśāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: sarve eṣām āśām paripūrayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will fulfill all his wishes.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs teṣāṃ yakṣasenāpatīnāṃ sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu mahāyakṣasenāpatayaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām yakṣa senāpatīnām sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu mahā yakṣa senāpatayaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to those Yakṣa generals, saying, Excellent, excellent, great Yakṣa generals!

original: yad yūyaṃ tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya kṛtajñatām anusmaramāṇānāṃ sarvasattvānāṃ hitāya pratipannāḥ //
analyzed: yat yūyam tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya kṛtajña tām anusmaramāṇānām sarva sattvānām hitāya pratipannāḥ
translated: That you, remembering the gratitude to that Blessed One, Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabha, the Tathāgata, are engaged in the welfare of all beings.

original: athāyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat ko nāmāyaṃ bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ nāma ayam bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: What is the name of this Dharma discourse, Blessed One?

original: kathaṃ cainaṃ dhārayāmi /
analyzed: katham ca enam dhārayāmi
translated: And how should I remember it?

original: bhagavān āha tena hi ānanda dharmaparyāyam idaṃ bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūrvapraṇidhānaviśeṣavistaram iti dhāraya /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tena hi ānanda dharmaparyāyam idam bhaiṣajyaguruvaidūryaprabhasya tathāgatasya pūrva praṇidhāna viśeṣa vistaram iti dhāraya
translated: The Blessed One said, Therefore, Ananda, remember this Dharma discourse as 'The Detailed Account of the Past Vows of the Tathagata Bhaisajyaguru-vaiduryaprabha,'

original: dvādaśānāṃ mahāyakṣasenāpatīnāṃ praṇidhānam iti dhāraya //
analyzed: dvādaśānām mahā yakṣa senāpatīnām praṇidhānam iti dhāraya
translated: and as 'The Vows of the Twelve Great Yaksha Generals.'

original: idam avocad bhagavān /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One.

original: āttamanā mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: ātta manāḥ mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ
translated: The youthful Manjushri was satisfied.

original: āyuṣmāṃś ca ānandaḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣmān ca ānandaḥ
translated: So was the Venerable Ananda.

original: trāṇamukto bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: trāṇa muktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva Tranamukta,

original: te ca bodhisattvāḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ
translated: those Bodhisattvas,

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ /
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ
translated: those great hearers,

original: te ca rājāmātyabrāhmaṇagṛhapatayaḥ /
analyzed: te ca rāja amātya brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ
translated: those kings, ministers, Brahmins, and householders,

original: sarvāvatī parṣat /
analyzed: sarvāvatī parṣad
translated: the entire assembly,
